3.9. 
Return of gifts 
1. If the marriage is not celebrated, both parties to a public agreement to marry shall be entitled to claim from each other the return of anything received by one of them as a gift from the other in connection with the future marriage, unless the value of the gift does not exceed three hundred euros and the party who received the gift has died prior to the registration of the marriage, and the marriage has not been contracted as a result of the death of the party. 
2. The provisions of Book Six of this Code governing relations relating to unjust enrichment or the acquisition of property shall apply to claims for the return of gifts. An action for restitution of a gift may be brought within the limitation period of one year from the date of the refusal to contract the marriage.
